intro: Dorotheanthus bellidiformis, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters. The plant features alternate, heart-shaped leaves with a hairy texture and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical characteristics make it a unique addition to both ornamental and ecological landscapes.
